description: Occurs when a CloudShell environment is connected from the AWS Management Console.
mitreAttackSubTechniques: T1059.009 - Command and Scripting Interpreter: Cloud API

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The CreateSession API is used to start an interactive AWS CloudShell session and requires authenticating into AWS Management cloud service.
The CreateSession API requires valid AWS credentials. Adversary with compromised credentials can then use CreateSession to spawn a shell environment to interact with AWS resources.

incidents.description: LUCR-3: SCATTERED SPIDER GETTING SAAS-Y IN THE CLOUD

researchLinks.description: Logging and monitoring in AWS CloudShell

securityImplications: Attackers could misuse valid credentials to call CreateSession and open an interactive shell to access cloud resources.
